newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-YANKEES' WHITEN ARRESTED FOR ALLEGED SEXUAL ASSAULT.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-YANKEES' WHITEN ARRESTED FOR ALLEGED SEXUAL ASSAULT.

text.p: New York Yankees outfielder Mark Whiten was arrested Monday on a sexual assault charge, Milwaukee police said.
Whiten, 30, was charged with second-degree sexual assault, said Sgt. Rebecca Pixley, adding that Whiten was due to be sent to the county jail where bond will be established by a judge.
Pixley would not disclose the site of the alleged assault or where Whiten was arrested. No date has yet been set for a pre-trial hearing.
Whiten left the team Wednesday and Thursday to be with his wife, Sheri, who gave birth to their second child in Clearwater, Florida.

The Yankees are the eighth major-league team for Whiten, who is batting .245 with five homers and 23 RBI. He also has played for Toronto, Cleveland, St. Louis, Boston, Philadelphia, Atlanta and Seattle.
